awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Conference: International Indian Statistical Association annual conference
awd_abstract_narration:
International Indian Statistical Association (IISA) 2023, a four-day international conference, will take place at Colorado School of Mines (Mines), Golden, Colorado from June 1 to June 4, 2023. The conference is an important event for researchers, students, and professionals in statistics, biostatistics, and data science. The conference provides a platform for emerging young researchers and students to share their theoretical and methodological research and applications in various scientific fields. It aims to promote the education, research, and application of statistics, probability, and data science while also fostering the exchange of information and scholarly activities among members. With a focus on diversity and inclusion, the conference provides numerous opportunities for women, minorities, and early-career researchers to participate in student paper competitions, speed sessions, short courses, plenary talks, invited sessions, and poster presentations. The conference also hosts a vibrant multi-stage student paper competition, highlighting the best research among early-career scholars.

From a technical perspective, IISA 2023 covers a wide range of topics from the fundamentals of statistical theory to computationally intensive methods and scientific application-oriented data modeling. It provides an opportunity for researchers and students to share their research in a variety of formats such as plenary talks, special invited talks, invited sessions, student paper competitions, posters, and panel discussions. The conference is an official annual meeting of the International Indian Statistical Association, and its main objective is to promote education, research, and application of statistics, probability, and data science, while also encouraging cooperation among members. With Mines and IISA as the primary organizers of the conference, the event promotes education and research in the Front Range area, fosters the exchange of information and scholarly activities among scientific institutions in the Front Range, Midwest, and across institutions in the United States. The conference website (https://www.intindstat.org/conference2023/index) provides up-to-date information and announcements regarding the conference.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The NSF award supported students and early career researchers for the International Indian Statistical Association (IISA) 2023 conference, which was held at the Colorado School of Mines (Mines) in Golden, Colorado, from June 1 to June 4, 2023 (https://www.intindstat.org/conference2023/index). The IISA is a non-profit organization with the objectives to promote education, research, and application of statistics and data science, to foster the exchange of information and scholarly activities, to serve the needs of young statisticians and data scientists, and to encourage cooperative efforts among its members. IISA membership is open to everyone, and IISA conferences are open to all, including non-members. Mines is a public university with a focus on science and engineering, committed to educating and inspiring students, advancing knowledge, and innovating to address the significant challenges society faces today, particularly those related to the earth, energy, and the environment.

The main objective of the IISA 2023 conference was to bring together both well-established and emerging young researchers, as well as students from around the world, who are actively pursuing theoretical and methodological research in statistics, biostatistics, and data science and their applications in various scientific fields. The conference provided a forum to discuss recent progress in statistical theory and applications, and integration with data science in various complex data problems, thereby providing new directions for statistical inference to make proper evidence-based discoveries from complex data.

The scientific program of the IISA 2023 conference spanned a wide range of topics, from the fundamentals of statistical theory to computationally intensive methods and scientific application-oriented data modeling. The sessions included plenary, special invited, invited, contributed oral presentations, discussions, and student paper and poster competitions and presentations.

In the tradition of past IISA conferences, IISA 2023 hosted vibrant multi-stage student paper competitions. The student paper award committees consisted of a combination of early-career researchers and established leaders in the field. The first stage, a pre-conference review, selected students' papers for oral presentations and a second-stage review. Student paper awards were given in two categories: theory and methodology of statistics and data sciences, including probability theory, and applications of statistics and data sciences. The 2023 student paper competitions were vibrant and received a strong array of submissions from a diverse range of students.

The 2023 conference program included 5 plenary presentations. These eminent speakers served as role models for the students and early career researchers, and their cutting-edge presentations fueled the growth of their research and learning. Additionally, the 2023 conference included 14 special invited talks delivered by leading researchers. IISA 2023 hosted 61 invited sessions. A significant percentage of the invited speakers at the IISA 2023 conference were early and mid-career researchers, who benefited from interactions with the plenary and special invited speakers, as well as senior researchers.

IISA 2023 strived to have programs that reflected the diversity in the field of statistics. The plenary and special invited speakers were from leading nationwide research institutions and included women researchers. Many Program Committee members and invited speakers were women and/or early-career researchers. In addition, a session was devoted to the collaboration among statisticians of African and Indian descent and another panel discussion session was on women’s issues sponsored by the ASA Committee on Women in Statistics.

The IISA 2023 conference promoted and fostered learning, research, and application of statistical science, probability, and data science, particularly among students, early career researchers, and the next generation of thinkers and leaders in statistics and data sciences.
